entities.description: "DSTC2 is a dataset used for evaluating the proposed method in the restaurant search domain."
"An internally collected dialogue corpus used for evaluating the proposed method in the movie booking domain."
"Shah et al., 2018 are associated with the generation of the movie booking dialogue corpus."
"Schatzmann et al., 2007 are associated with the development of the user simulator used in the dialogue corpus generation."
"Henderson et al., 2013 are associated with the dialogue act definition used in the system action mapping."
"Henderson et al., 2014a are associated with the DSTC2 dataset."
"Kingma and Ba, 2014 are associated with the Adam optimization method used in the training settings."
"An expert user is involved in correcting mistakes made by the agent in tracking the user's goal at the end of each dialogue turn."
"The agent is involved in dialogue policy and is corrected by expert users for mistakes in tracking user goals."
"The training corpus is a collection of dialogues used to train the agent's dialogue policy."
"The supervised model is trained on the aggregated corpus to obtain an updated dialogue policy."
"Reinforcement Learning is a method used to optimize the neural dialogue system with human feedback."
"Human feedback is used to optimize the neural dialogue system after the imitation learning stage."
"The neural dialogue system is optimized with Reinforcement Learning and Human Feedback."
"The softmax policy is used during RL training to encourage the agent to explore the dialogue action space."
"The REINFORCE algorithm is applied in optimizing the network parameters in the neural dialogue system."
"The discount factor (Î³) is a component in the objective function of the REINFORCE algorithm, used to weigh the importance of future rewards."
"The likelihood ratio gradient estimator is used to derive the gradient of the objective function in the REINFORCE algorithm."
"An unbiased gradient estimator is provided by the last expression of the objective function in the REINFORCE algorithm."
"Dialogue state tracking is used to estimate goal slot values and determine the success of a dialogue."
"The user simulator is used to interact with the end-to-end training agent during imitation and reinforcement learning stages."
"A user profile is randomly selected for each dialogue simulation conducted by the user simulator."
"Natural language surface forms are used during model evaluation to assess the generalization capability of the end-to-end model."
"System actions are sampled from the learned policy to encourage exploration in imitation learning."
"A dialogue act is a unit of communication that is mapped to a system action and a candidate value for a slot type."
"Slot types and values are components of the dialogue state tracking output, used in system action definition."
"The Adam optimization method is used in the training settings with an initial learning rate of 1e-3."
"A dropout rate of 0.5 is applied during supervised training to prevent the model from over-fitting."
"In imitation learning, the model is updated after collecting every 25 dialogues in mini-batches."

relationships.description: "Both DSTC2 and Movie Booking Dialogue Corpus are datasets used for evaluating the proposed method in different domains."
"The movie booking dialogue corpus was generated by Shah et al., 2018."
"The user simulator used in the generation of the movie booking dialogue corpus was developed by Schatzmann et al., 2007."
"The Adam optimization method used in the training settings was developed by Kingma and Ba, 2014."

entities.description: "Carnegie Mellon University is an educational institution located in Pittsburgh, PA, USA, and is associated with the research presented in the text."
"Google Research is a research organization based in Mountain View, CA, USA, involved in the development of task-oriented dialogue systems."
"Samsung Research is a research organization located in Mountain View, CA, USA, contributing to the field of dialogue systems."
"Bing Liu is an individual affiliated with Carnegie Mellon University and is a contributor to the research on dialogue systems."
"Gokhan Tur is an individual associated with Google Research and is involved in the study of task-oriented dialogue systems."
"Dilek Hakkani-Tur is a person affiliated with Google Research, contributing to the development of dialogue agents."
"Pararth Shah is an individual associated with Google Research, working on the design of neural network-based dialogue agents."
"Larry Heck is an individual affiliated with Samsung Research, involved in the research on task-oriented dialogue systems."
"Pittsburgh is a city in Pennsylvania, USA, and is the location of Carnegie Mellon University."
"Mountain View is a city in California, USA, and is the location of both Google Research and Samsung Research."
"Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems is the central topic of the research, focusing on systems that assist users in completing tasks through dialogue."
"Rudnicky et al. are referenced in the context of conventional task-oriented dialogue systems, indicating their contribution to the field."
"Raux et al. are mentioned in relation to the complex pipeline of task-oriented dialogue systems, suggesting their involvement in the domain."
"Young et al. are cited in the context of task-oriented dialogue systems, implying their research contributions to the area."
"Mesnil et al. are referenced in the context of natural language understanding within dialogue systems."
"Liu and Lane are mentioned in relation to natural language understanding, indicating their work in the field."
"Hakkani-Tur et al. are cited in the context of natural language understanding, suggesting their contributions to the domain."
"Henderson et al. are mentioned in relation to dialogue state tracking, indicating their research in this area."
"Mrksic et al. are referenced in the context of dialogue state tracking, suggesting their involvement in the field."
"Gasic and Young are mentioned in relation to dialogue policy learning, indicating their research contributions."
"Shah et al. are cited in the context of dialogue policy learning, implying their work in this area."
"Su et al. are mentioned in relation to dialogue policy learning, suggesting their contributions to the field."
"Wen et al. are referenced in the context of supervised learning based task-oriented dialogue systems."
"Bordes and Weston are mentioned in relation to supervised learning, indicating their work in the field."
"Zhao and Eskenazi are cited in the context of deep reinforcement learning based systems."
"Li et al. are mentioned in relation to deep reinforcement learning, suggesting their contributions to the domain."
"Peng et al. are referenced in the context of deep reinforcement learning, indicating their research in this area."
"Williams and Zweig are mentioned in relation to the robustness of systems trained with reinforcement learning."
"Ross et al. are mentioned in relation to dialogue policy fine-tuning, suggesting their contributions to the field."

relationships.description: "Carnegie Mellon University is involved in the research and development of Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems."
"Google Research contributes to the advancement of Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems."
"Samsung Research is engaged in the research and development of Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems."
"Bing Liu is a researcher at Carnegie Mellon University working on Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems."
"Gokhan Tur is a researcher at Google Research involved in the study of Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems."
"Dilek Hakkani-Tur is a researcher at Google Research contributing to the development of Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems."
"Pararth Shah is a researcher at Google Research working on the design of neural network-based Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems."
"Larry Heck is a researcher at Samsung Research involved in the research on Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems."

entities.description: "Dialogue State Tracking is the process of maintaining the state of a conversation, such as userâs goals, by accumulating evidence along the sequence of dialogue turns."
"KB Operation involves forming an API call command to retrieve information from a knowledge base based on dialogue state tracking outputs."
"Dialogue Policy is the selection of the next system action in response to the userâs input based on the current dialogue state."
"Utterance Encoding is the process of encoding the user utterance to a continuous representation using a bidirectional LSTM."
"Natural Language Generator is responsible for generating the final natural language system response using dialogue action, user goal tracking results, and query results."
"PolicyNet is a deep neural network used to model the dialogue policy, selecting the next system action based on the dialogue state."
"The API call command is produced by replacing tokens in a query command template with the best hypothesis for each goal slot from the dialogue state tracking output."
"The Knowledge Base is a source of information from which the API call command retrieves data based on the dialogue state tracking outputs."
"The User Utterance is the input from the user at each turn of the dialogue, which is encoded by the Utterance Encoding process."
"The User Goal is the objective of the user, which is tracked and estimated by the Dialogue State Tracking process."
"Query Results are the outcomes returned from the Knowledge Base after the API call command is executed."
"The User Model is a source of additional information used to rank Knowledge Base entities along with the issued query."
"The External Recommender System is responsible for ranking Knowledge Base entities, using richer features than just entity posterior probabilities."
"The Belief Tracker is a component that maintains a probability distribution over candidate values for each goal slot type."
"SlotDist is a single hidden layer MLP with softmax activation used to calculate the probability distribution over slot types."
"LSTM_D is the dialogue-level LSTM that maintains the dialogue state in a continuous form and is updated after processing each dialogue turn."

"The Policy Network is a deep neural network that models the dialogue policy and takes dialogue-level LSTM state, log probabilities from the belief tracker, and encoding of query results summary as inputs."
"The N-best List is a list of API calls generated with the most probable candidate values for the tracked goal slots."
"Symbolic Queries are the queries sent by the model to the Knowledge Base, leaving the ranking of entities to an external recommender system."
"Ranking of KB Entities is a process done by the External Recommender System using richer features than just following entity posterior probabilities."
"Item Availability is part of the summary of query results, indicating whether items are available or not."
"Number of Matched Items is part of the summary of query results, indicating how many items matched the query."
"Query Command Template is a template used to form the API call command by replacing tokens with the best hypothesis for each goal slot."
"Dialogue Act is the system action emitted by the Policy Network, conditioning on the dialogue state, log probabilities, and encoding of query results summary."
"Turn k refers to a specific point in the dialogue where the user utterance is processed, and the dialogue state is updated accordingly."
"Turn k-1 refers to the previous point in the dialogue before turn k, where the system output is encoded for the next state update."

relationships.description: "Dialogue State Tracking uses the encoding of user utterance from Utterance Encoding to update the dialogue state."
"KB Operation uses the outputs from Dialogue State Tracking to form an API call command to retrieve information from a knowledge base."
"Dialogue Policy uses the dialogue state from Dialogue State Tracking to select the next system action."
"Natural Language Generator uses the dialogue action from Dialogue Policy to generate the final natural language system response."
"PolicyNet uses the dialogue state from Dialogue State Tracking as one of its inputs to emit a system action."

entities.description: "DSTC2 is an event where dialogue state tracking is evaluated, and it is used as a benchmark for the supervised learning model performance."
"Movie Booking Corpus is another event used for evaluating the supervised learning model's performance on dialogue state tracking."
"RNN refers to a type of model used for comparison with the proposed model in the DSTC2 corpus, standing for Recurrent Neural Network."
"NBT stands for Neural Belief Tracker, another model used for comparison with the proposed model in DSTC2 corpus."
"Henderson et al., 2014b refers to the authors of a study that used RNN for dialogue state tracking, which is compared to the proposed model."
"MrkËsiÂ´c et al., 2016 refers to the authors of a study that used NBT for dialogue state tracking, which is compared to the proposed model."
"Imitation Learning is a method used to improve the task success rate of the model by learning from user interactions."
"Reinforcement Learning is a method used to optimize the model's performance after Imitation Learning, aiming to improve task success rate."
"End-to-End Training is a training setting for Reinforcement Learning that optimizes the entire system, compared to policy-only training."
"Policy-Only Training is a training setting for Reinforcement Learning that focuses only on the policy, without end-to-end system optimization."
"User's True Goal Values are the actual intentions of the user that the system aims to match with the dialogue state tracking."
"The System refers to the dialogue management entity that is tracking user goals and confirming them with the user."
"The User is the individual whose goal values are being tracked and confirmed by the System."
"Dialogue State Tracking is the process of estimating the user's goal from the dialogue and is central to the system's functionality."
"ASR Transcriptions are used as user input utterances in the evaluation on the DSTC2 corpus, representing a technology used in the process."
"Text Based Input is used in the movie booking domain as a lower noise level input method for dialogue state tracking."
"Task Success Rate is a metric used to evaluate the performance of the model, indicating the proportion of successful dialogues."
"Dialogue Turn Size is a metric that measures the number of turns in successful dialogues, indicating the efficiency of the model."
"DST Accuracy is a metric used to evaluate the model's performance on dialogue state tracking."
"Interactive Learning involves the model learning from user interactions, which includes both imitation and reinforcement learning."
"Live ASR Transcriptions are used as user input in the DSTC2 evaluation, indicating a real-time technology application."
"User NLG Templates are used during interactive evaluation, representing a technology for generating user utterances."
"Supervised Learning Model is the model that is initially trained and later improved with interactive learning techniques."
"Compounding Errors refer to the cumulative mistakes made by the model due to mismatches in dialogue state distribution."
"Dialogue State Distribution is the pattern of user goals that the model must learn to handle effectively."
"Dialogue Agent is the entity that learns strategies to complete tasks with fewer dialogue turns, representing the system's interactive component."
"Human Teaching is a part of the interactive learning process where the model learns from human interactions."
"Challenging Tasks are dialogue scenarios that the model struggles with, leading to higher compounding errors and task failure."
"Easy Tasks are simpler dialogue scenarios that the model can handle with fewer dialogue turns."
"SL + RL Model refers to the Supervised Learning model that is enhanced with Reinforcement Learning."
"SL + ÎÎ©IL 500 + Î¼ RL Model refers to the Supervised Learning model with 500 episodes of imitation learning and continued RL optimization."

relationships.description: "Both DSTC2 and Movie Booking Corpus are used as benchmarks to evaluate the performance of the supervised learning model on dialogue state tracking."
"RNN is a model used for comparison with the proposed model on the DSTC2 benchmark."
"NBT is a model used for comparison with the proposed model on the DSTC2 benchmark."
"Henderson et al., 2014b published results using RNN for dialogue state tracking, which is compared to the proposed model on DSTC2."
"MrkËsiÂ´c et al., 2016 published results using NBT for dialogue state tracking, which is compared to the proposed model on DSTC2."
"Imitation Learning is applied before Reinforcement Learning to improve the task success rate of the model."
"End-to-End Training is compared to Policy-Only Training to show the advantages of system-wide optimization in Reinforcement Learning."

entities.description: "Ross et al., 2011 is referenced for their work on dialogue sample aggregation in the context of fine-tuning dialogue policy."
"Young et al., 2013 is cited for their approach to learning task-oriented dialogue by modeling the task as a partially observable Markov Decision Process (POMDP)."
"GaËsiÂ´c et al., 2013 is mentioned for applying reinforcement learning in the POMDP framework to learn dialogue policy online."
"Serban et al., 2015 is referenced for their work on end-to-end solutions for task-oriented dialogues, inspired by encoder-decoder based neural network models."
"Li et al., 2016 is mentioned for their contribution to the design of end-to-end solutions for task-oriented dialogues."
"Wen et al., 2017 is cited for designing an end-to-end trainable neural dialogue model with modularly connected system components."
"Henderson et al., 2008 is referenced for showing that reinforcement learning may effectively improve dialogue success rate by exploring a large dialogue action space."
"Li et al., 2017 is mentioned for their work on reinforcement learning in dialogue systems."
"Bordes and Weston, 2017 is cited for proposing a task-oriented dialogue model using end-to-end memory networks."
"Seo et al., 2016 is mentioned for exploring the use of query-regression networks to learn dialogue state."
"Liu and Perez, 2017 is cited for their work on gated memory networks in dialogue systems."
"Eric and Manning, 2017 is mentioned for their contribution to copy-augmented networks to learn dialogue state."
"JurcËÄ±Â´Ëcek et al., 2012 is referenced for showing the critical role of robust dialogue state tracking in improving dialogue success in task completion."
"Dhingra et al., 2017 is cited for proposing an end-to-end RL dialogue agent for information access, focusing on differentiability to the KB query operation."
"Williams et al., 2017 is mentioned for proposing a hybrid code network for task-oriented dialogue that can be trained with supervised and reinforcement learning."
"The user teaching process is a method to reduce user teaching cycles and continue the learning process with reinforcement learning and user feedback."
"The neural network based task-oriented dialogue system is designed for end-to-end optimization for natural language understanding, dialogue state tracking, and dialogue policy learning."

"The hybrid imitation and reinforcement learning method is proposed for end-to-end model training to address the dialogue state distribution mismatch between offline training and interactive learning."
"End-to-end task-oriented dialogue systems are discussed in relation to building models inspired by encoder-decoder based neural network models in non-task-oriented conversational systems."
"Encoder-decoder based neural network models are the inspiration for end-to-end solutions for task-oriented dialogues."
"The end-to-end trainable neural dialogue model is designed with modularly connected system components and is evaluated on fixed dialogue corpora."
"Reinforcement learning is used to improve dialogue success rate by exploring a large dialogue action space and is part of the proposed model training method."
"The task-oriented dialogue model using end-to-end memory networks is proposed to track userâs goal for effective integration with knowledge bases."
"Query-regression networks are explored for learning the dialogue state without slot filling or user goal tracking."
"Gated memory networks are used in the research line of task-oriented dialogue to learn dialogue state."
"Copy-augmented networks are mentioned in the context of learning dialogue state directly from dialogue history."
"The end-to-end RL dialogue agent focuses on differentiability to the knowledge base query operation and handles entity updates and additions in the knowledge base."
"The hybrid code network is proposed for task-oriented dialogue and can be trained with both supervised and reinforcement learning."
"The hierarchical LSTM neural network is used to encode a dialogue with a sequence of turns in the proposed end-to-end task-oriented dialogue model."
"The bidirectional LSTM utterance encoder is used to encode user input to the system in natural language format to a continuous vector."
"The dialogue-level LSTM maintains a continuous representation of the dialogue state based on user utterance encoding and previous system action encoding."
"The knowledge base is where the system formulates and issues query commands based on the state tracking outputs to retrieve requested information."
"The natural language generator is responsible for generating the final natural language system response based on the dialogue action, user goal tracking results, and query results."
"NAACL-HLT is an event where research papers on dialogue systems are presented."
"Minjoon Seo is an author of a paper on query-regression networks for machine comprehension."
"Ali Farhadi is an author of a paper on query-regression networks for machine comprehension."
"Hannaneh Hajishirzi is an author of a paper on query-regression networks for machine comprehension."
"Iulian V Serban is an author of a paper on building end-to-end dialogue systems using generative hierarchical neural network models."
"Alessandro Sordoni is an author of a paper on building end-to-end dialogue systems using generative hierarchical neural network models."
"Yoshua Bengio is an author of a paper on building end-to-end dialogue systems using generative hierarchical neural network models."
"Aaron Courville is an author of a paper on building end-to-end dialogue systems using generative hierarchical neural network models."
"Joelle Pineau is an author of a paper on building end-to-end dialogue systems using generative hierarchical neural network models."
"Pararth Shah is an author of papers on dialogue systems, including one on bootstrapping a neural conversational agent."
"Dilek Hakkani-Tur is an author of papers on dialogue systems, including one on bootstrapping a neural conversational agent."
"Liu Bing is an author of a paper on bootstrapping a neural conversational agent with dialogue self-play."
"Gokhan Tur is an author of a paper on bootstrapping a neural conversational agent with dialogue self-play."
"Larry Heck is an author of a paper on interactive reinforcement learning for task-oriented dialogue management."
"Pei-Hao Su is an author of papers on dialogue management, including one on sample-efficient actor-critic reinforcement learning."
"Pawel Budzianowski is an author of a paper on sample-efficient actor-critic reinforcement learning for dialogue management."
"Stefan Ultes is an author of papers on dialogue management, including one on sample-efficient actor-critic reinforcement learning."
"Milica Gasic is an author of papers on dialogue management, including one on sample-efficient actor-critic reinforcement learning."
"Nikola Mrksic is an author of papers on dialogue management, including one on online active reward learning for policy optimisation."
"Lina RojasBarahona is an author of a paper on online active reward learning for policy optimisation in spoken dialogue systems."

"SIGDIAL is an event where research papers on dialogue systems, such as sample-efficient actor-critic reinforcement learning, are presented."
"ACL is an event where research papers on dialogue systems, such as online active reward learning for policy optimisation, are presented."
"EACL is an event where research papers on dialogue systems, such as network-based end-to-end trainable task-oriented dialogue systems, are presented."
"NIPS is an event that hosts workshops, including the Deep Learning for Action and Interaction Workshop where dialogue management papers are presented."
"Jason D Williams is an author of papers on end-to-end dialog control optimized with supervised and reinforcement learning."
"Kavosh Asadi is an author of a paper on hybrid code networks for practical and efficient end-to-end dialog control."
"Geoffrey Zweig is an author of papers on end-to-end dialog control and hybrid code networks for dialog control."
"Ronald J Williams is an author of a paper on simple statistical gradient-following algorithms for connectionist reinforcement learning."
"Blaise Thomson is an author of a review paper on Pomdp-based statistical spoken dialog systems."
"IEEE is an organization that publishes proceedings, including a review on Pomdp-based statistical spoken dialog systems."
"Tiancheng Zhao is an author of a paper on end-to-end learning for dialog state tracking and management using deep reinforcement learning."
"Maxine Eskenazi is an author of a paper on end-to-end learning for dialog state tracking and management using deep reinforcement learning."
"Amazon Mechanical Turk is a platform used for recruiting human judges for evaluations in this study."
"SL model refers to a dialogue system that is trained using supervised learning from dialogue corpora."
"IL stands for Imitation Learning, a method used to improve the neural dialogue model by learning from user teaching and feedback."
"RL stands for Reinforcement Learning, a method applied to further improve the model performance after Imitation Learning."

"End-to-End RL Optimization is the process of optimizing the dialogue agent by training with RL, where the gradient propagates from the system action output layer back to the natural language user input layer."
"Human User Evaluations is the event where human judges rate dialogues between the model and user simulator on a scale of 1 to 5."

"Hybrid Imitation and Reinforcement Learning Method is the proposed approach for training task-oriented dialogue systems, combining supervised learning, imitation learning, and reinforcement learning."
"Dialogue State Tracking Accuracy is the evaluation metric used to measure the model's ability to track dialogue states, with results showing improvement through imitation learning."
"Task Success Rate is an evaluation metric that measures the model's performance in completing tasks, showing improvement with imitation and reinforcement learning."
"Imitation Learning is a method where the model learns from human teaching, quickly improving dialogue state tracking accuracy."
"Reinforcement Learning is used to optimize the dialogue policy and further improve the model's performance after imitation learning."
"End-to-End Training refers to the training approach where the entire model is updated during RL, as opposed to policy-only training."
"Policy-Only Training is an RL training approach where only the policy network parameters are updated, with other system parameters fixed."
"User Teaching is the process where the model learns from user feedback, which is a part of the imitation learning process."
"User Feedback is used in reinforcement learning to further improve the model's performance after imitation learning with user teaching."
"Fixed Corpus refers to a static set of dialogues used for evaluating the model's performance in dialogue state tracking."
"NLG Templates are new natural language generation templates introduced in the interactive evaluation, affecting the model's accuracy."
"Neural Dialogue Model is the model that is adapted and improved through imitation learning with human teaching and reinforcement learning."
"Dialogue Agent refers to the system that engages in dialogues, which is improved through the proposed hybrid learning approach."
"Interactive Learning is the process where the model learns and improves through interaction with users."
"User Simulator is a tool used to simulate user interactions for evaluating the dialogue system's performance."
"Human Judges are individuals recruited to rate the system's turns in dialogues, providing evaluations for the study."
"Evaluation Results refer to the outcomes of the model's performanceè¯ä¼°, which show the benefits of the proposed learning method."
"Offline Evaluation is the assessment of the model's performance using fixed dialogue corpora."
"Interactive Evaluation is the assessment of the model's performance through real interactions with users."
"Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems are systems that focus on completing specific tasks through interactions with users."
"User Interactions are communications between the dialogue agent and users, which are used for training and improving the agent."
"Mistakes are errors made by the agent during user interactions, which are learned from to improve the system."

relationships.description: "Amazon Mechanical Turk is used to recruit human judges for the Human User Evaluations event."
"The SL model is the initial dialogue system trained in the Hybrid Imitation and Reinforcement Learning Method."
"IL is a part of the Hybrid Imitation and Reinforcement Learning Method, used to improve the dialogue agent by learning from user teaching and feedback."
"RL is a part of the Hybrid Imitation and Reinforcement Learning Method, used to further improve the model performance after Imitation Learning."
"End-to-End RL Optimization is a specific application of RL, where the entire model is updated during training."
"The SL model is one of the three models evaluated during the Human User Evaluations event."
"The performance of the model after 1000 episodes of IL is evaluated during the Human User Evaluations event."
"The performance of the model after SL and IL followed by RL is evaluated during the Human User Evaluations event."

entities.description: "PolicyNet is a single hidden layer MLP with softmax activation function over all system actions, used in dialogue state tracking and policy network."
"Dialogue state tracking is a system component that predicts the true user goal slot values and the next system action at each turn of a dialogue."
"System action prediction is a system component that predicts the next system action at each turn of a dialogue."
"Task-oriented dialogue samples are used to train the system in a supervised manner, fitting the model to predict user goal slot values and system actions."
"Dialogue agent is the entity that interacts with users using its learned dialogue policy, collecting additional dialogue samples and learning from human teaching."
"Human teaching involves users correcting mistakes made by the dialogue agent and demonstrating expected actions and predictions, which is used to update the dialogue policy."
"User feedback is collected as reward during the agent's interaction with users, used to update the model and obtain an updated policy."
"Query results are used in the encoding process, represented by $E_{k}$, and are part of the inputs for the policy network."
"Utterance encoding is a system component that processes inputs in a continuous form for the dialogue system."
"The end-to-end model refers to the training approach where all system components are trained together as a single model."
"Model parameter set $\theta$ represents the parameters of the model that are optimized during the training process."
"Cross-entropy losses are used in the optimization process to minimize errors in dialogue state tracking and system action prediction."
"Linear interpolation is used to combine the losses for dialogue state tracking and system action prediction."
"Ground truth label $l_{k}^{m*}$ represents the correct label for the tracked user goal slot type at the kth turn."
"True system action $a_{k}^{*}$ is the actual system action taken in the corpus, used for training the model."
"Dialogue imitation learning is the method proposed to allow the dialogue agent to learn from human teaching."
"Covariate shift refers to the change in the distribution of dialogue states due to the agent's mistakes or user behavior deviations."
"Compounding errors are errors that accumulate due to covariate shift, potentially leading to task failure."
"Expert user is the individual who corrects the agent's mistakes in tracking the user's goal at the end of each dialogue turn."
"Annotated dialogues are dialogues that have been corrected and annotated by expert users, added to the training corpus."
"Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback is a method where the model is updated based on user feedback collected as reward."

relationships.description: "PolicyNet is used in dialogue state tracking to predict user goal slot values and system actions."
"PolicyNet is used in system action prediction to predict the next system action at each turn of a dialogue."
"Task-oriented dialogue samples are used to train the dialogue agent in a supervised manner."
"The dialogue agent learns from human teaching by interacting with users and collecting additional dialogue samples."
"Human teaching involves collecting user feedback to update the dialogue policy."
"Query results are used as input for PolicyNet to predict system actions."
"Utterance encoding is a component of the end-to-end model for task-oriented dialogue."
"Model parameter set $\theta$ is optimized by minimizing cross-entropy losses."
"Linear interpolation is used to combine different cross-entropy losses in the optimization process."
"Ground truth label $l_{k}^{m*}$ is used to track the user goal slot type in dialogue state tracking."
"True system action $a_{k}^{*}$ is used to train the system action prediction component."

entities.description: "ICASSP is an event where research papers on topics such as Bayesian spoken dialogue systems are presented."
"Milica Gasic is an author who contributed to a paper on Gaussian processes for dialogue manager optimization in 2014."
"Steve Young is an author who has contributed to multiple papers on dialogue systems and language processing."
